channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HBASE-16490] Fix race condition between SnapshotManager and SnapshotCleaner
item.description:
As Matteo Bertozzi comments on HBASE-16464, there maybe race condition between SnapshotManager and SnapshotCleaner. We should use one lock when create snapshot, and cleanup should acquire the lock before take action.

One method is pass HMaster as param into Cleaner through FileCleanerDelegate.getDeletableFiles, suggestions are welcomed.
item.summary: Fix race condition between SnapshotManager and SnapshotCleaner

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment: Currently, there is no way to pass some instance into FileCleanerDelegate subclasses, i think we could add one method "init(Map<String, Object> params)" into FileCleanerDelegate , use it as init method after construction, so we could pass any instance which is needed into subclass, wdyt? Matteo Bertozzi

yeah something along this line seems good.
passing arguments to the cleaner like this seems already ok as it is to me.

but we don't want a global lock on the snapshot manager. we want a lock on the snapshotName since each snapshot can run concurrently and the cleaner knows which snapshot wants to remove from .tmp since the folder is .tmp/snapshotName/
use snapshot file lock to replace ".inprogress" tag introduced in HBASE-16464 and address Matteo Bertozzi comments.

-1 overall

can we use KeyLocker instead of the custom acquire/release lock? or maybe make IdLock take a T as key?
patch v2 fix failed testcase and use keylocker as Matteo Bertozzi suggestion.

Looks good overall.

For CleanerChore.java , the following import is not used:


+import org.apache.hadoop.hbase.master.HMaster;



-      return cache.getUnreferencedFiles(files);

+      return cache.getUnreferencedFiles(files, master.getSnapshotManager());

You don't need HMaster in order to access SnapshotManager. Take a look at MasterServices.java :


  SnapshotManager getSnapshotManager();



+   *  key is snapshot's filename in progress, value is the relates lock

relates -> related
Thanks Ted Yu, will address your comments when commit.
